His killer used the scissors to cut the bed open and drown him.', 'The person was killed by electrocution using the scissors as a conductor.', 'The person was killed by a poison injected into their body using the scissors.']

question: A fireman is running to get a net under a lady who looks like she might jump off the balcony of her 20 story apartment building. There is nothing below her except a 20 story fall. The fireman is still 100 yards away when she falls and can't nearly get there in time. The woman is not hurt more than a bruise. How is that possible?
choice_list: ['She was wearing a parachute and landed safely.', 'The woman fell onto a trampoline that was placed below her balcony.', 'She fell back into her apartment, jumping from the balcony into the inside.', 'The fireman caught her mid-air.']

question: A man goes out drinking every night, returning to his home in the wee hours of every morning. No matter how much he drinks, he never gets a hangover. This drink is very well known, but is rarely consumed, served warm and taken straight from its source. The man is a sucker for a free drink, especially since he can't live without it. What is his favorite drink?
There is a dead man in the middle of a field, nothing is around him and there are no footprints of any sort. There is an unopened package next to him. How did he die?

A pet shop owner had a parrot with a sign on its cage that said "Parrot repeats everything it hears". Davey bought the parrot and for two weeks he spoke to it and it didn't say a word. He returned the parrot but the shopkeeper said he never lied about the parrot. How can this be?
choice_list: ['The parrot is deaf.', '"The parrot was sick and unable to speak"', '"The parrot was trained not to speak"', '"The parrot was scared and didn\'t feel comfortable speaking"']

question: The prisoner was locked up in a room with a dirt floor. The room has one window, which is high up above the prisoner's height. The prisoner had a shovel, but he had only 2 days to get out, and digging would take him more than 5. How would he escape?
choice_list: ['The prisoner would use the shovel to break the window and escape through the broken glass.', 'The prisoner would use the shovel to dig a tunnel under the dirt floor and escape through it.', 'The prisoner would use the shovel to create a hole in the wall and escape through it.', 'He would use the shovel to make a pile of dirt to climb up to the window and jump out.']

question: A Japanese boat was stuck in water because of the storm, and after the storm, the captain was found dead. The engineer was busy fixing the signals, the cook was managing the wine barrels, the wife went to the room, and the maid was fixing the upside-down turned flag. Who killed the captain?
choice_list: ['The maid. A Japanese flag is the same from all sides, with a red dot in the center of a white background.', 'The wife', 'The cook', 'The engineer']

question: A man was found dead while on his work trip abroad. The suspects were his colleagues Mason, Bob, Lisa, and Alex. On the calendar, 3, 4, 9, 10, 11 were written in blood. How should the detectives decode the numbers to find the killer?
choice_list: ["The numbers are those of the months whose first letters spell out 'Mason'.", 'The numbers represent the dates on which the victim had important meetings with each of the suspects.', 'The numbers indicate the order in which the suspects were seen leaving the crime scene by a witness.', 'The numbers correspond to the number of times each suspect had interacted with the victim on the trip.']

question: Dr. Miller was staying with his cousin, Alfred, in Alfred's lakeside cabin. They were setting up Alfred's will. Since Dr. Miller was Alfred's closest living relative, much of Alfred's estate was being left to him.One day, Alfred went to Dr. Miller very upset."Doctor," he began, "I have just found out that an old enemy is out to get me. He is coming very soon. Where will I go? Where can I hide? If he finds me, he will surely kill me. I do not have time to leave this cabin and hide in the woods."Dr. Miller thought for a moment, and then grabbed a 5√¢‚Ç¨¬≤ long bamboo fishing pole, with a diameter the size of a quarter."Alfred, follow me out to the lake. This lake is 4√¢‚Ç¨¬≤ deep. If you lie on the bottom of the lake and breathe through this pole, your enemy will never find you. I will be in the bulrushes with a shotgun, and I will shoot him when he comes. I will swim down to find you when he is gone."Alfred thought that was a great idea and went down to the lake with the bamboo pole in his mouth.A few hours later, a ranger passed by. He found Alfred's body. Dr. Miller told the police of the circumstance, and that Alfred had probably panicked, and died.Police arrested Dr. Miller on the charge of murdering Alfred. Why?
choice_list: ['Alfred was attacked by a wild animal', 'Alfred had a heart attack', "The pole was 5√¢‚Ç¨¬≤ long, but only the size of a quarter. The first time he breathed in, he breathed oxygen. When he exhaled, the air could not travel 5√¢‚Ç¨¬≤ before he breathed in again. He was just breathing what he exhaled. Before long, all he was breathing was carbon dioxide. He died of CO2 poisoning. Dr. Miller was the one who told him to use the pole. However, he was knowledgeable about the human body and knew breathing only carbon dioxide would result in Alfred's death. His motive? The money in Alfred's will.", 'Alfred drowned in the lake']

question: A renowned chemist is found dead in his lab. There is no clear evidence except a piece of paper lying by the body. The paper is blank other than the name of five elements scrawled across it hastily:NickelCarbonOxygenLanthanumSulfurThe guard reported that three people visited the chemist that day √¢‚Ç¨‚Äú his sister, Laura; his colleague, Nicolas; and his wife, Tessa. The criminal was arrested immediately. Who was it?
choice_list: ['His colleague, Nicolas. The list of the elements forms a clue, the abbreviations spell out his name.', 'The guard', 'Laura', 'Tessa']

question: One winter day, there was a man standing in the middle of someone's front yard. The person stayed there for several weeks without moving and the owner of the yard didn't mind. Eventually, the man left. Who was he?
choice_list: ['A lost hiker', 'A homeless person', 'A snowman.', 'A statue']

question: There were three men swimming in the sea. When the coastguard called them into the beach, only two of the men had wet hair. Why?
choice_list: ['The third man was wearing a swimming cap.', 'The third man had just dried his hair before coming out of the water.', 'The third man had a waterproof hair product on his head.', 'The third man was bald.']

question: A crime was committed in the middle of a forest, which left the police stumped. Who did it?
Two chickens were found dead on the farm. What does the detective suspect?
Why did a woman call the police over a man who knocked on her door and claimed that he thought the room was his?
choice_list: ['The woman called the police because she was scared of the man.', "If it was his room, he wouldn't have knocked.", 'The woman called the police because she thought the man was a burglar.', 'The woman called the police because she believed the man was trespassing.']

question: Why was the detective's wife furious when he arrived home at 9:30 when he said he'd arrive home at 9:30?
choice_list: ['Because he brought home the wrong groceries', 'Because he arrived home late', 'Because he forgot to call her', 'Because she thought it would be 9:30 PM, and he turned up at 9:30 AM!']

question: A killer told a detective that he would commit his next crime in the only place in Paris where you couldn't see the Eiffel Tower. How did the detective end up catching him?
choice_list: ['The criminal was hiding in the Eiffel Tower itself.', 'The detective found the killer in the Louvre Museum.', 'The detective discovered the killer in the Catacombs of Paris.', 'The detective apprehended the killer at the Notre-Dame Cathedral.']

question: A truck driver is going down a one-way street in the wrong direction. A police car drives past him but doesn't stop him. Why?
choice_list: ["The police car didn't notice the truck driver.", 'The police car was on a different street.', 'The truck driver was not breaking any traffic laws.', "Because he isn't driving down the street - he's walking."]

question: Every day, a woman was seen crossing the border carrying bags of sand on a bicycle. After some time, the border police become suspicious and stop her, but found she only had sand on her, so they let her go. Years later, they get a mysterious invitation for a party at a large villa. The owner comes out to greet them, it is the woman that has been crossing for years! How did this happen?
choice_list: ['She disguised the bicycles as bags of sand.', 'She used a teleportation device', 'She had a secret tunnel under the border', 'She was smuggling bicycles.']

question: A woman calls up the police to say that her grandmother's ring had been stolen. When they visit her house, they see broken glass on the lawn and dirty footprints. They arrest the woman. Why?
choice_list: ["The woman's fingerprints were found on the broken glass.", 'The woman was the only one present at the house when the police arrived.', 'If someone had broken into the house, they would have left broken glass inside the house - the window was broken from the inside.', 'The woman had a history of stealing valuable items.']

question: A man entered his house and was about to hang up his coat when he heard his wife shout;"No John! Don't do it!"There was a shot and he could hear his wife fall down. When he entered the kitchen he saw his wife and the gun lying on the floor. There was a police officer, a doctor, and a lawyer standing next to her. Peter immediately knew that the police officer had shot her.But how did he come to know?
choice_list: ['he police officer was the only one with a weapon', 'he police officer had a guilty expression on his face', 'he police officer was holding the gun', 'The police officer has a name on his badge.']

question: A couple went on for a climbing trip. But only the husband returned from the vacation and said that his wife slipped off while climbing and died. On investigating, the local sheriff arrested him saying, 'Your travel agent called. You murdered your wife.'The man did not inform anyone about the trip. Then how did the agent was so sure that it is a murder?
choice_list: ['he travel agent overheard the man discussing his plans to kill his wife', 'The man bought only a one-way ticket for his wife whereas he bought a two-way ticket for himself. It means that he was sure that he will be returning alone.', "he man had a history of violence and had previously threatened his wife's life", "he man's wife had recently taken out a large life insurance policy, making the travel agent suspicious"]

question: A young boy went to a Catholic school. During school, he started goofing around, so the teacher called him out and sent him to the Pastor. Since this was a traditional school the boy would be spanked, but the Pastor believed in giving people a chance.He said, "If you can ask me a question about something you learned and I don't know the answer on the spot you will go free."The boy may have been lazy, but he was very witty. He asked, "What is it that you can see and I can see, usually every day, but God cannot see." The Pastor stood there, stumped. He couldn't figure it out because he strongly believed that God sees and knows all, and that there is only one God. The boy smiled and told him.What was it?
choice_list: ['His own reflection! We see our reflections in mirrors every day, but since God is not physical, he cannot see his own reflection.', 'His own future! We can see and plan for our own future, but God, being outside of time, already knows the future and cannot see it like we can.', 'His own equal! We see our equals everyday, but since there is one God, he cannot see someone equal to himself.', 'His own thoughts! We can see and know our own thoughts, but God, being all-knowing, already knows everything including his own thoughts.']

question: Once there was an evil wizard. He took 3 women from their homes and turned them into rose bushes that looked exactly alike. He then put them in his garden.One of the women had a husband and children and begged the wizard to let her see them. He agreed. At night he brought the woman to her house. In the morning he came and took her home.The next day the husband decided to go rescue her. So he snuck into the wizard's garden. He looked and looked at the 3 identical rose bushes trying to figure out which could be his wife. Suddenly he knew the answer and he took his wife home. How did he know which rose bush was his wife?
choice_list: ['The husband recognized his wife because she had a small marking on one of her petals.', 'The husband recognized his wife because she was the tallest rose bush.', 'The husband recognized his wife because she had a different scent than the other rose bushes.', 'The wizard brought the rosebush to her home at night and returned her to the garden in the morning. Therefore, she was the only plant without dew.']

question: A wealthy man lives alone in a small cottage. Being partially handicapped, he had everything delivered to his cottage.The mailman was delivering a letter one Thursday when he noticed that the front door was ajar. Through the opening, he could see the man's body lying in a pool of dried blood.When a police officer arrived he surveyed the scene. On the porch were two bottles of warm milk, Monday's newspaper, a catalog, flyers, and unopened mail.The police officer suspects it was foul play. Who does he suspect and why?
choice_list: ['The mailman', "The wealthy man's neighbor", 'The catalog delivery person', "The police officer suspects the newspaper delivery person. The absence of Tuesday's and Wednesday's newspaper indicates that the delivery person knew there was no one there to read it."]

question: A dead body is found at the bottom of a multistory building. Seeing the position of the body, it is evident that the person jumped from one of the floors, committing suicide.A homicide detective is called to look after the case. He goes to the first floor and walks into the room facing the direction in which the body was found.He opens the window in that direction and flips a coin towards the floor. Then he goes to the second floor and repeats the process. He keeps on doing this until he reaches the last floor. Then, when he climbs down he tells the team that it is a murder, not suicide.How did he come to know that it was a murder?
choice_list: ["The detective discovered a suicide note in the victim's handwriting, but upon further examination, it was determined to be a forgery. This led the detective to believe that someone had staged the scene to look like a suicide.", 'The detective found fingerprints on the windowsill of the room where the body was found, suggesting that someone had touched the window after the person jumped.', 'None of the windows were left open. If the person jumped, who closed the window?', 'The detective noticed that there were no signs of forced entry or struggle on any of the floors, indicating that someone must have let the murderer into the building.']

question: Dave and Brad, two popular politicians, met at a club to discuss the overthrow of their party leader. They each ordered a vodka on the rocks. Brad downed his and ordered another. He then drank his second in a gulp and decided to wait before he ordered a third. Meanwhile, Dave, who was sipping his drink, suddenly fell forward dead. Both men were set up for assassination. Why did Dave die and Brad live?
choice_list: ['Dave died because he accidentally ingested a different poisonous substance earlier in the day.', 'Dave died because he had an allergic reaction to an ingredient in his drink.', "Both Dave and Brad were given drinks with poisoned ice cubes. Brad drank his drinks so quickly that the ice didn't have time to melt and release the poison.", 'Dave died because he had a pre-existing medical condition that caused him to have a sudden heart attack.']

question: A man is found murdered on a Sunday morning. His wife calls the police, who question the wife and the staff, and are given the following alibis: the wife says she was sleeping, the butler was cleaning the closet, the gardener was picking vegetables, the maid was getting the mail, and the cook was preparing breakfast.Immediately, the police arrest the murderer. Who did it and how did the police know?
choice_list: ['he gardener. He could have used a gardening tool to commit the murder', 'The maid. There is no mail on Sundays.', 'he butler. He could have used the cleaning supplies as a weapon', 'he wife. She was the only one who had the opportunity to be near the victim']

question: A man owned a casino and invited some friends.It was a dark stormy night, and they all placed their money on the table right before the lights went out.When the lights came back on, the money was gone.The owner put a rooster in an old rusty tea kettle.He told everyone to get in line and touch the kettle after he turned the lights off, and the rooster will crow when the robber touched it.After everyone touched it, the rooster didn't crow, so the man told everyone to hold out their hands.After examining all the hands, he pointed out who the robber was.How did he know who stole the money?
choice_list: ["Because the tea kettle was rusty, whoever touched it would have rust on their hands. The robber didn't touch the kettle, therefore he was the only one whose hands weren't rusty.", 'The robber confessed to stealing the money', 'The owner saw the robber stealing the money', 'The rooster crowed when the robber touched the kettle']

question: One day, the police found a man dead inside a hut. In his left hand, he's holding a gun. In his right hand, he has a recording. When the recording is played, the police hear the man talking about how horrible life is and how he wants it to end. The recording ends with a gunshot. The police are about to call it a suicide until you point out a very important clue. What is it?
choice_list: ['The man had a history of mental illness and had previously attempted suicide, making it more likely that he took his own life.', "The recording played a gunshot inside it. If the man committed suicide, he wouldn't have been able to stop the recording after he pulled the trigger.", 'There were no signs of forced entry or struggle in the hut, indicating that the man was alone and willingly ended his life.', 'The man was left-handed, so it would be impossible for him to hold the gun in his left hand and shoot himself.']

question: What month are trees scared of?
Who walks little pumpkins across the road to school?
choice_list: ['The school bus driver', 'The pumpkin farmer', 'The crossing gourd.', 'The scarecrow']

question: What did the ocean say to the ship's captain?
choice_list: ['"Prepare for a storm"', 'Nothing, it just waved.', '"I\'m ready to set sail"', '"Smooth sailing ahead"']

question: What does a tree do when it gets homesick?
choice_list: ['It calls its friends', 'It leaves.', 'It cries', 'It grows taller']

question: When do the leaves begin to turn?
choice_list: ['The first day of spring', 'The night before a test.', 'The first day of summer', 'The first day of winter']

question: I produce moisture and oxygen into the air.When it gets cold, I change colors.When it freezes, I fall down, even if it's not slippery.What am I?
How can you tell a dogwood tree apart from other trees?
choice_list: ['By its bark.', 'By its flowers', 'By its leaves', 'By its height']

question: I make ash, but I'm not a bonfire.I can expel rocks, but I'm not a slingshot.I can be a mountain, but I'm not in the Himalayas.I have a crater, but I'm not the Moon.I erupt, but I don't have a bad temper.What am I?
If fruit comes from a fruit tree, where does chicken come from?
Bright pearls were scattered on a black cloth.What are they?
We're very large though we seem small,We float on high and never fall,We shine like jewels in the night,But in the day concealed from sight.What are we?
I saw a restless shepherd travelingBack and forth on his path.He garbs himself in that which goesIn the same and in an opposite direction.He goes hither and thither among creatures.What is it?
Two little golden horns sitting on a cloud, They float slowly in the sky,And look very proud.What is it?
choice_list: ['A hot air balloon', 'A unicorn', 'A young moon.', 'A pair of sunglasses']

question: Hick-a-more, Hack-a-more, On the kitchen floor;All the horses, all the men,Couldn't driveHick-a-more, Hack-a-more,Off the kitchen floor.
What falls on the water but never gets wet?
What has no hands, no feet, no head, and no body, but can open any door?
When rain falls, does it ever get up again?
White sheep on a blue hill.When the winds stop, they stand still.They walk far away when the winds blow.What are they?
I gently patter on the roof at night. I mutter quietly and lull you to sleep, asking, "All sleeping? All right!"What am I?
What man cannot live inside the house?
An old woman sweeps behind the house, but the dust turns up at your doorstep.What is it?
choice_list: ['A broom', 'A gust of wind', 'A vacuum cleaner', 'A blizzard.']

question: Riddle me, riddle me, rin-√ê¬µ-go, mother gave me some seeds to sow. The seeds were black, the ground was white. If you riddle me that, you'll escape my bite.What are they?
choice_list: ['Pen and paper.', 'Keyboard and screen', 'Typewriter and parchment', 'Pencil and notebook']

question: It is energy and motion, it can fly across the ocean.It can listen and even speak, it can see and even seek.It eats neither fruit nor gruel, it eats energy and fuel.Better say: It doesn't eat; It is transformed into heat.What is it?
The shape of my form will waver and bendBy the things I'm destroying and those I will rend.My color changes from bright red to blue,The power I'm using will dictate my hue.What am I?
A house full, a hole full, but you can never gather a bowl full.What is it?
I'm so weak that a little wind can move me.I'm so strong that when you cut me with a knife, it leaves no track.What is it?
What is it that anyone can divide, but no one can see where it is divided?
As I was going o'er London Bridge, I heard something crack. Not a man in all England can mend that!What is it?
My step is slow, and I breathe snow.To the ground, I bring death.My marching brings an end to me,I'm slain by the sun or engulfed by the sea.What am I?
I am all that you see, yet I'm nothing at all, and from you, I will flee.Formed of deception, I will twist your perception.Wherever I'm rising, I warp the horizon.What am I?
If you like being in nature and want to camp overnight, you can sleep in one of these.What is it?
There is a common plantThat's like something in the sky.It is bright yellow,And grows to be 10 feet high.What is it?
I bloom in yellow-golden,With fluffy little chicks.From the cold, I turn barren.What am I?
Colorful flowersBloomed in the garden,Beautiful colorsBut autumn is coming.What flowers are they?
What tree grieves the most?
choice_list: ['The sorrowful pine', 'The sad oak', 'The weeping willow.', 'The mourning maple']

question: What animal can jump higher than a tree?
A house with two residents - sometimes one, seldom three.Crack the walls, eat the dwellers, then throw it away.What is it?
choice_list: ['A bag with almonds', 'A box with cashews', 'A pod with peanuts.', 'A shell with pistachios']

question: I have lots of bark but no bite. What am I?

I am a plant you use in food, and my name consists of 5 letters.Remove the first letter of my name, and you'll get a form of energy.Get rid of two, and you'll get something necessary for life.Scramble together the last 3 letters, and you can drink it.What am I?
I am a small seed, and there are three letters in my name.Take away two letters, and I still sound the same.What am I?
The moon is my mother, The sea is my dad.I have a million brothers.When I reach land, I'm dead.What am I?
There's a bridge in a hollowAnd a hundred cross itNo mason, no blacksmith, nor carpenter built it.What is it?
choice_list: ['A wooden plank', 'A stone path', 'A rope bridge', 'A frozen river.']

question: You will find me in the mountains, and you'll find me in a creek.I have no mouth, but I speak every tongue.I have no ears, yet I answer every cry, and I always have the final word.What am I?
We are the pearls of night stolen in the light of day.What are we?
I can run but never walk,Have a mouth but never talk,Have a head but never weep,Have a bed but never sleep.What am I?
A thousand colored folds stretch toward the sky,Atop a tender strand,Rising from the land,'Til killed by maiden's hand.Perhaps, as a token of love.Perhaps, to say goodbye.What is it?
My love, when I gaze on thy beautiful face,Careering along, yet always in place -The thought has often come into my mindIf I ever shall see thy glorious behind.
Walks in the wind but stands where there's moist,Counts time, stops clocks,Swallows kingdoms, gnaws rocks.What is it?
What has roots that nobody sees,Is taller than trees,Up, up it goes,And yet never grows?
choice_list: ['A flagpole', 'A hot air balloon', 'A skyscraper', 'A mountain.']

question: What falls but never breaks?
What is thick but thin as a puff,What is short but tall as a bluff,What brings peace and calms the sea,What dazzles the eyes of you and me?
I'm gentle enough to soothe your skin,Light enough to fly through the sky,Strong enough to crack rocks.What am I?
I can fly but have no wings,I can cry but have no eyes,Wherever I go, darkness follows me.What am I?
What month are trees scared of?
Who walks little pumpkins across the road to school?
choice_list: ['The pumpkin farmer', 'The scarecrow', 'The crossing gourd.', 'The school bus driver']

choice_list: ['Nothing, it just waved.', '"I\'m feeling a bit salty today"', '"Smooth sailing ahead"', '"You\'re in deep water now"']

question: 1 duck saw 4 elephants as it was going toward the river.Every elephant noticed 2 monkeys going to the river.Every monkey was carrying 1 dove in its paws.How many animals are going to the river?
choice_list: ['Three animals are moving toward the river.', 'Seven animals are moving toward the river.', "Five animals are moving toward the river.Here's a detailed answer:1 duck noticed 4 elephants as it was going toward the river. Hence, 1 animal (the duck) is moving to the river.The 4 elephants saw 2 monkeys going walking toward the river. Now comes the tricky part. You may think that each elephant saw 2 different monkeys walking toward the river. So you would conclude that 4 x 2 = 8 monkeys were going to the river.However, the task does not explicitly say that each elephant saw DIFFERENT monkeys. In fact, you can logically infer that the elephants saw the SAME 2 monkeys. Hence, we only have 2 additional animals (monkeys) moving toward the river.Since every monkey was carrying 1 dove, the 2 monkeys were carrying 2 doves in total.Summing up, we have 1 duck, 2 monkeys, and 2 doves moving to the river. 1 + 2 + 2 = 5 animals.", 'Four animals are moving toward the river.']

question: 1 duck saw 4 elephants as it was going toward the river.Every elephant noticed 2 monkeys going to the river.Every monkey was carrying 1 dove in its paws.How many animals are going to the river?
choice_list: ["Five animals are moving toward the river.Here's a detailed answer:1 duck noticed 4 elephants as it was going toward the river. Hence, 1 animal (the duck) is moving to the river.The 4 elephants saw 2 monkeys going walking toward the river. Now comes the tricky part. You may think that each elephant saw 2 different monkeys walking toward the river. So you would conclude that 4 x 2 = 8 monkeys were going to the river.However, the task does not explicitly say that each elephant saw DIFFERENT monkeys. In fact, you can logically infer that the elephants saw the SAME 2 monkeys. Hence, we only have 2 additional animals (monkeys) moving toward the river.Since every monkey was carrying 1 dove, the 2 monkeys were carrying 2 doves in total.Summing up, we have 1 duck, 2 monkeys, and 2 doves moving to the river. 1 + 2 + 2 = 5 animals.", 'Four animals are moving toward the river.', 'Three animals are moving toward the river.', 'Seven animals are moving toward the river.']

question: 1 duck saw 4 elephants as it was going toward the river.Every elephant noticed 2 monkeys going to the river.Every monkey was carrying 1 dove in its paws.How many animals are going to the river?
choice_list: ["Five animals are moving toward the river.Here's a detailed answer:1 duck noticed 4 elephants as it was going toward the river. You may think that each elephant saw 2 different monkeys walking toward the river. So you would conclude that 4 x 2 = 8 monkeys were going to the river.However, the task does not explicitly say that each elephant saw DIFFERENT monkeys. In fact, you can logically infer that the elephants saw the SAME 2 monkeys. Hence, we only have 2 additional animals (monkeys) moving toward the river.Since every monkey was carrying 1 dove, the 2 monkeys were carrying 2 doves in total.Summing up, we have 1 duck, 2 monkeys, and 2 doves moving to the river. 1 + 2 + 2 = 5 animals.", 'Seven animals are moving toward the river.', 'Three animals are moving toward the river.', 'Four animals are moving toward the river.']

question: Old Mr. Smith was found dead in his study by young Jack. I noticed his study light was on and I decided to peek in from the outside to see if he was in there. There was frost on the window, so I had to wipe it away to see inside. That is when I saw his body. So I kicked in the front door to confirm my suspicions of foul play. I called the police immediately afterward." choice_list: ['Three animals are moving toward the river.', 'Seven animals are moving toward the river.', 'Four animals are moving toward the river.', "Five animals are moving toward the river.Here's a detailed answer:1 duck noticed 4 elephants as it was going toward the river. You may think that each elephant saw 2 different monkeys walking toward the river. question: My first letter is in sea but not in ocean,The second is in change but not in motion.My third letter in boat but never in ship,And the fourth is in travel as well as in trip.The fifth letter is in dark but not in caves,And my whole is a triangle popping up from the waves.  What am I?

I peel like an onion yet remain whole.Which mystery creature am I?

question: I can slash but I have no knife, I can dash but I have no legs, I can pound but I have no hammer, I can star but I have no stage. What am I?

I look flat, but I am deep, Hidden realms I shelter. Lives I take, but food I offer. At times I am beautiful. I can be calm, angry and turbulent. I have no heart, but offer pleasure as well as death. No man can own me, yet I encompass what all men must have. What am I?

question: I run through hills; I veer around mountains. I leap over rivers and crawl through the forests. Step out your door to find me. What am I?

question: Tool of thief, toy of queen. Always used to be unseen. Sign of joy, sign of sorrow. Giving all likeness borrowed. What am I?
I'm not clothes but I cover your body; The more I'm used, the thinner I grow. What am I?
I am born in fear, raised in truth,and I come to my own in deed.When comes a time that I'm called forth,I come to serve the cause of need.What am i?

Creatures of power, creatures of grace,Creatures of beauty, creatures of strength.As for their lives, they set everything's pace,For all things must come to live under their emerald embrace. . .Either in their life, or in their death.What am I?
If you break me, I'll not stop working.If you can touch me, my work is done.If you lose me, you must find me with a ring soon after.What am I?
First you see me in the grass dressed in yellow gay;next I am in dainty white, then I fly away. What am I?
I weaken all men for hours each day.I show you strange visions while you are away.I take you by night, by day take you back,None suffer to have me, but do from my lack.What am I?
Iron roof, glass wallsBurns and burnsAnd never falls.What am I?

Armless, legless, I crawl around when I'm young.Then the time of changing sleep will come.I will awake like a newborn, flying beast,'till then on the remains of the dead I feast.Who am I?
From house to house I go,sometimes narrow,sometimes wide.And whether there's rain or snow,I always stay outside.What am I?

I have wings, but I'm no bird.I have a bow and arrow, but I'm not Robin Hood.I'm a Roman god, but I'm not Jupiter.I look like a toddler, but I need no diaper.My image expresses love, but I'm not a heart.Who am I?
Balloons and cards, and bearsUse this red shape to sayThat I love you so muchEvery Valentine's Day.What is it?

question: I come in many shades: red, pink, yellow, orange, or white; but I'm not a crayon.I'm fragrant, but I'm not perfume.People put me in water, but I'm not dirty laundry.I have a stem, but I'm not a wine glass.People gift me on Valentine's day, but I'm not a stuffed animal.What am I?
What did one oar say to the other on Valentine's day?

question: What do you call a rather small Valentine?
One of Santa's reindeer also works on Valentine's Day? Which one?
What flower sounds very kissable?
What can be touched, but can't be seen?
I'm tiny but quite expensive. But when you use me, all I do is hang and sparkle.What Valentine's Day gift am I?
You'll see two of me at every wedding, but I am not a person.What am I?
choice_list: ['A wedding ring.', 'A bouquet of flowers', 'A wedding dress', 'A wedding cake']

question: I connect two people, but I touch only one.What am I?

question: I have no finish line in sight, but you can break me. Once you have me, you are bound for life.What am I?
I am another word for love, and I consist of nine letters. I rhyme with selection and perfection.What am I?
I can make you happy, I can make you cry. I can make you want me, but I can also drive people to madness.What am I?
When I'm lost, I hurt the most, as well as when not had at all. I'm often hard to express and easy to ignore. You can give me to just one person, or to many. What am I?
What part of the ocean is considered the most romantic?
choice_list: ['The place where the "buoy" meets the "gull."', '"The Love Reef"', '"The Romance Bay" ', '"The Passionate Cove"']

question: I can be clogged, and I can break. I can be given but also kept. I can be crushed or be made whole. What am I?
From that which comes within itself,It builds its table on my shelf.What is it?
I wiggle and I cannot see,Sometimes I'm underground, and at times on a tree.I really don't want to end up on a hook,I turn into a person when combined with a book.What am I?
I have legs but rarely walk.I bite many but never talk.I search for places that can hide me,Because those that feed me also hate me.What am I?
What animal can lend you a buck?
choice_list: ['A cow', 'A horse', 'A goat', 'A deer (male deer are called bucks).']

question: I have around 5,000 feathers and I'm a bird native to America. People say Benjamin Franklin wanted me to be the national bird of the United States.What am I?
choice_list: ['A turkey.', 'A blue jay', 'A robin', 'A bald eagle']

question: What do you call a cow sucked up by a tornado?
choice_list: ['A tornado steak', 'A twister burger', 'A milkshake.', 'A cyclone smoothie']

What do you call a cow spying on another cow?
choice_list: ['"A moo-nitoring"', '"A cattle surveillance"', 'A steak out.', '"A bovine espionage"']

question: I stash treasures in the ground,And dig them out in winter.You can find me in a tree,Nibbling on my nutty dinner.What am I?
What is the first animal in space?

question: What goes tick-tock, bow-wow, tick-tock, bow-wow?
choice_list: ['"A cat meowing"', '"A cow mooing"', 'A watch dog.', '"A bird chirping"']

choice_list: ["Because it's too slow.", "Because it's too big.", "Because it's always spotted.", "Because it's too noisy."]

question: I have no arms and legs. I crawl on my belly, and I have a lethal sting. When I go to sleep, I curl into a ring but I leave my eyes open wide. What am I?
I live on a farm and I'm pink.I'm famous for saying "oink...oink."Come near me, and you'll realize I stink.What am I?
My arms are longer than my legs, and I can be taught sign language to communicate with humans.What am I?
I grow down as I grow up.What am I?
choice_list: ['A ladder', 'A goose - goose feathers are called down.', 'A tree', 'A mountain']

question: I am always black and whiteBut I'm not an old TVI'm a kind of animalThat begins with the letter ZWho am I?

question: What king do you make if you take the head of a llama, the middle of a pig, the back of a buffalo, and the tail of a stallion?
Sneaky as a shadow in the dead of night,Cunning but affectionate if given a bite.Never owned but often loved.What am I?
What kind of can doesn't need a can-opener?
choice_list: ['A soup can', 'A soda can', 'A pelican.', 'A tuna can']

question: I'm grey, but I'm no wolf,I have long ears, but I'm not a rabbit,I have hooves, but I'm not a cow.What am I?
I'm a pet with cute ears, four legs, and a tail at the end.You surely heard me barking. I'm known as man's best friend.What am I?
Some are afraid of this creature,Because it has a large bite.So be careful out in the ocean,One of its kin is a Great White.What is it?
Throughout the day I rest and sleep.At night, I fly and hunt.I have no feathers on my wings,Nor do I chirp or grunt.What am I?
I am named after the animal I eat.What am I?
I may be small, but I can climb a tower.What am I?
I'm not a superhero, but I have a cape. I have a comb, but I don't use it on my hair, and I am famously territorial.What am I?
This is a type of animalKnown for its long face.It's very good at runningSo people ride it in a race.
What do you call a three-humped camel?
What lives in a tiny house all alone?
choice_list: ['A baby chick in an egg.', 'A mouse in a hole', 'A spider in a web', 'A bird in a nest']

question: My first letter is in sea but not in ocean,The second is in change but not in motion.My third letter in boat but never in ship,And the fourth is in travel as well as in trip.The fifth letter is in dark but not in caves,And my whole is a triangle popping up from the waves.  What am I?
My first letter is in cloud, but never in sky.The second is in roll but not in lie,My third letter is in water but not in trees.My whole makes you milk, kefir, and cheese.What am I?

My first letter is in follow but not in lead, and the second is in write but not in read.My third letter is in sky but not in cloud, my fourth is in humble but not in proud.My all makes circles in a bowl, or lies on a plate cooked up whole.What am I?
I sizzle like bacon, but I hatched from an egg,I expand when I eat, and I have no legs.What am I?
I have got a crown like a king, but I'm a disgrace when I sing.There are fewer eyes on my face than my tail, but only when I'm a male.What am I?
I'm the opposite of a dog, but I'm not a god.I move my tail when I'm mad and growl when I'm pleased.What am I?
I feed on leaves from treetops but my feet never leave the earth.What am I?
I go to school all my life, and I never leave the water, even though I breathe air. What am I?
I often join you at parties and holidays, but I never get to enjoy them.What am I?
I grow from egg to fish to creature.I burp when I talk and I jump when as I walk.What am I?
I have no legs, eyes, or nose, but if you give me enough time, I can move the earth.What am I?
I have black circles around my eyes - even when I'm not exhausted.What am I?
Play me with a ball and bat. Or hear me sing in a tophat.What am I?
Alive without breath, as cold as death.All in mail never clinking.Never thirsty, ever drinking.What am I?
Born in water, I drown in water.A blood-thirsty beast you can barely see.What am I?
As small as your thumb, I am light in the air.You may hear me before you see me, But trust me, I'm there.What am I?
I have a face like a tree and skin like the sea.A great beast I am, yet small vermin frighten me.What am I?
I create my lair with earthen string,And dispatch my prey with a biting sting.What am I?
I had no father, only a grandfather... I shall bear no sons, only daughters.What am I?
I plow and plow but never sow.What am I?
I have four legs but no tail. Usually, I am heard only at night.What am I?
What is that which, while it lives, constantly changes its habit, That is buried before it is dead, and whose tomb is valued wherever it is found?

My first letter is in window but not in pane.My second's in road but not in lane.My third is in oval but not in round.My fourth is in hearing but not in sound.My whole is known as a sign of peace.And from Noah's Ark, I won quick release.What am I?
A prickly house a little host contains.The pointed weapons keep back from pains,So he, unarmed, safe in his fort remains.Who is he?
What can honk without a horn?
I am an insect, and the first part of my name is another insect.What insect am I?
My first letter is in ocean but never in sea.My second's in wasp but never in bee.My third is in glider and also in flight.My whole is a creature that comes out at night.What am I?

Oh, how I love my dancing feet!They stay together - oh so neat.And when I want to walk a line,They all stay together and do double time.I count them up, ten times or more,And race on-off, across the floor.
I can jump, I can swim,I swing from tree to tree.And I can also weave a houseThat's much bigger than me.What am I?
It can be in a hat,Or out of the bag.If you see it you'll be smitten,'Cause it's fluffy like a mitten.What is it?
It's small but larger than a bee,And agile as a flea.It hums but does not buzz,And it's not covered with fuzz.It is a small collectorOr juicy flower nectar,What is it?
It can be white, blue, or black,Humped or have a horn.And when it talks, it sings its minuets,As it's traveling the depths.What is it?
I have no sword, I have no spear,Yet rule a horde that many fear,My soldiers fight with a wicked sting,I rule with might, yet I'm no king.What am I?
The cow is my cousin.If you see my name, you'll understand why.What am I?
What has armor but is not a knight,Snaps but is not a twig,And is always at homeEven on the move?
If a man could carry my burden, he would break his back.I am not rich, but leave silver in my track.What am I?
I hang upside-down on trees.I'm the opposite of busy bees.I sleep and sleep, I'm very slow, and on each footI have three toes.What am I?
I am both a bird and a kind of fruit, and I can even be a person.What am I?
You say "hey." I'll eat it.I say "neigh."What am I?
My start goes on toast, and my end's how birds move.My baby eats leaves, whereas I drink flowers.
Cupid without a bow.Donner with no kebab.One who dances, one who prances, all dragging present-giving dad.What am I?
I've got a hole in my back and legs I lack.I live where I can't breathe and I eat without teeth.What am I?
When I walk, I jump, and when I stand, I sit.What animal am I?
I peel like an onion yet remain whole.Which mystery creature am I?
I walk on silken strings and catch all sorts of things.When you find my home, I am gone.What am I?
I'm the only known mammal incapable of jumping. That's because I'm very large.What animal am I?
My field of vision is 270 degrees, and I'm quiet and sneaky like a ninja when I hunt for my prey.What bird am I?
I was born small and pink, but then I grew big and black and white.I'm lazy to cook, so all I eat is bamboo.What animal am I?
I've got horns, but I can't honk.Instead, I bleat, but I'm no sheep.What am I?
I hover and zip through the air with a dazzling flare.I move from flower to flower, humming a tune, but I'm no insect.What am I?
I am a king, and the jungle is my kingdom.I have a lush mane, and I'm tough to train.What am I?
I live in a den, and I wear a furry suit.I like to eat fish, but also berries and fruit.I love honey more than you do.What animal am I?
I wear a tuxedo when I'm swimming, and I slide on my tummy across the ice.What am I?
I have a mane, but I'm no lion. I wear shoes, but I'm not a human.What am I?
I have a lump or two on my back, and I live in the sand.I'm tough and I'll carry you over the land.What am I?
I'm spotty and swift, but I'm no leopard.And no one wants to play cards with me.What am I?
The alphabet starts with A and ends in Z. I go the other way around.What am I?
I am an animal, but my name makes you think of dessert or something you might put in your hair.What am I?
It takes me a couple of weeks to digest what I eat, and I'm never in a hurry.What am I?
You may find me cute, but I'm too big for a pet.I have a long trunk, and I never forget.What am I?
Long and slinky like a trout, never sings till its guts come out. What is it?
choice_list: ['It is a gun.', 'A fishing rod', 'A snake', 'A harmonica']

question: Whether old Homer tippled wine or beer, Julep or cider, history is not clear; But plain it is-the bard, though want to roam, But for one liquid, never had left home. What is it?
choice_list: ['The color red', 'The letter R.', 'A rainstorm', 'A river']

question: Inside a burning house, this thing is best to make. And best to make it quickly, before the fire's too much to take! What is it?

A harvest sown and reaped on the same day In an unplowed field, Which increases without growing, Remains whole though it is eaten Within and without, Is useless and yet The staple of nations. What is it?
What is that which has many leaves, but no stem?
You do not want to have it,But when you do have it,You do not want to lose it.What is it?

I give you a group of three. One is sitting down, and will never get up. The second eats as much as is given to him, yet is always hungry. The third goes away and never returns. What are the three things?
choice_list: ['Chair, plate, wind', 'Stove, fire, and smoke.', 'Table, dog, shadow', 'Bed, child, dream']

question: As destructive as life, As healing as death; An institutioner of strife, Just as prone to bless. It is all that is good, Yet with an evil trend; As it was the beginning of things, It can also be the end. What is it?
What is that which the dead and living do at the same time?
What is that which is invisible, but never out of sight?
Round as an apple, Deep as a cup, All the King's horses Can't pull it up. What is it?
Black within, red without, with four corners, roundabout. What is it?
As I went across the bridge, I met a man with a load of wood which was neither straight nor crooked. What kind of wood was it?
Formed long ago, yet made today, Employed while others sleep. What none would freely give away. Nor any wish to keep. What is it?
Man walks over, man walks under, in times of war he burns asunder. What is it?
In a tunnel of darkness lies a beast of iron. It can only attack when pulled back. What is it?
What is something you don't own but you can give it to anyone you meet? You only have one, but you can give it away as many times as you want without losing it. What is it?
Big as a biscuit, deep as a cup, even a river can't fill it up. What is it?
choice_list: ['A bathtub', 'A kitchen strainer.', 'A swimming pool', 'A bucket']

question: A dozen Royals gathered round, Entertained by two who clowned. Each King there had servants ten, Though none of them were also men. The lowest servant sometimes might, Defeat the King in a fair fight. A weapon stout, a priceless jewel, The beat of life, a farmer's tool. What is it?
choice_list: ['A Deck of Cards.', "A Jester's Hat", 'A Chessboard', 'A Crown Jewels']

question: The Pope has it but he does not use it. Your father has it but your mother uses it. Nuns do not need it. Your lady friend's husband has it and she uses it. What is it?
choice_list: ['A middle name', 'A Last Name.', 'A nickname', 'A maiden name']

question: Nothing on the outsideNothing on the insideLight as a featherYet ten men cannot lift it.What is it?
What can climb mountains, cross streams, handle hundreds of feet each day, yet never moves? What is it?
My name is two letters. You call many people by this name, but yet their first name is not this. What is it?
White bird, featherless, flyin' out o' paradise, flyin' over sea and land, dyin' in my hand. What is it?
My teeth are sharp, my back is straight, to cut things up it is my fate. What am I?
choice_list: ['Scissors', 'Saw', 'Knife', 'tricky riddle, hard riddle, logic riddle, what is it, word riddle']

question: Where is the AD before BC, tomorrow before yesterday, and the eight is first?
choice_list: ['In a secret code.', 'In a time machine.', 'In a dictionary.', 'In a history book.']

question: Which word in the English language becomes shorter when it is lengthened?
Rock and roll, rock and roll. What rocks but does not roll?
What is often returned but never borrowed?

Used to threaten, used to defeat. Sometimes it grows, sometimes it shrinks. Used to conquer, used to protect. It marks your downfall, it marks your success. The true god of war, the creator of mess. What is it?
Often held but never touched, always wet but never rusts, often bites but seldom bit, to use me well you must have wit. What am I?
What has no hands but might knock on your door, and if it does you better open up?
What never gets any wetter, no matter how much it rains?
It goes up, but at the same time goes down. Up toward the sky, and down toward the ground. It's present tense and past tense too, come for a ride, just me and you. What is it?

Marble walls as white as milk, lined with skin as soft as silk, in a fountain crystal clear, a golden apple will appear, there is no key to this stronghold, yet theives break in and steal the gold. What is it?
What has 88 teeth but never brushes them?
The leaves are on the fruit, The fruits is on the leaves. What is it?
Glittering points that downward thrust, sparkling spears that never rust. What is it?
choice_list: ['An Icicle.', 'A disco ball', 'A diamond', 'A shooting star']

question: Never resting, never still. Moving silently from hill to hill. It does not walk, run or trot, All is cool where it is not. What is it?
What can go up and come down without moving?
You can see it every day, But cannot ever touch it. What is it?
A beggar's brother died, but the man who died had no brother.How could this be?
choice_list: ['"The beggar\'s brother was adopted"', '"The beggar\'s brother was a figment of his imagination"', 'The beggar was a woman', '"The beggar\'s brother was actually his sister"']

question: What goes into the water red,But black when you pull it out?
I am born in fear, raised in truth,and I come to my own in deed.When comes a time that I'm called forth,I come to serve the cause of need.What am i?
Name-called and favorite to eat,Has only two toes on print of feet,Colors many,Almost any Country child would have seen one.What is it?
It comes only before,It comes only after,Rises only in darkness,But rises only in light.It is always the same,But is yet always different.What am I?
An arm points north, east, south, then west.Ever in circles, never pausing to rest.It passes its brother twenty three times,As the sun passes by and the moon starts to climb.What is it?
Placed above it makes greater things small.Placed beside it makes small things greater.In matters that counts it always comes first.Where others increase it keeps all things the same.What is it?
If you break me, I'll not stop working.If you can touch me, my work is done.If you lose me, you must find me with a ring soon after.What am I?
What measures out time,Until in timeAll is smashed to it?
All about, but cannot be seen,Can be captured, cannot be heldNo throat, but can be heard.What is it?
A precious stone, as clear as diamond.Seek it out whilst the sun's near the horizon.Though you can walk on water with its power,Try to keep it, and it'll vanish in an hour.What is it?
At night they come without being fetched,And by day they are lost without being stolen.Whar are they?

A horrid monster hides from the day,With many legs and many eyes.With silver chains it catches prey,And eats it all before it dies.Yet in every cottage does it stay,And every castle 'neath the sky.What is it?
Runs smoother than any rhyme, loves to fall but cannot climb!
Large as a mountain, small as a pea,Endlessly swimming in a waterless sea.What am I?
People are hired to get rid of me.I'm often hiding under your bed.In time I'll always return you see.Bite me and you're surely dead.What am I?
I do not breathe, but I run and jump.I do not eat, but I swim and stretch.I do not drink, but I sleep and stand.I do not think, but I grow and play.I do not see, but you see me every day.What am I?
I make you weak at the worst of all times.I keep you safe, I keep you fine.I make your hands sweat, and your heart grow cold,I visit the weak, but seldom the bold.What am I?
Walk on the living, they don't even mumble. Walk on the dead, they mutter and grumble.What are we?
Lovely and round,I shine with pale light,grown in the darkness,A lady's delight.What am I?

Inside me the adventurous findQuests and treasures of every kind.Trolls, goblins, orcs, and more, awaitWithin my closed walls forAll those that wish to visit me.Your hands are the keyTo secrets untold,And your mind will unlock the door.What am I?
Hands she has but does not hold,teeth she has but does not bite,feet she has but they are cold,eyes she has but without sight.Who is she?
Three lives have I.Gentle enough to soothe the skin,Light enough to caress the sky,Hard enough to crack rocks.

Of no use to oneYet absolute bliss to two.The small boy gets it for nothing.The young man has to lie for it.The old man has to buy it.The baby's right,The lover's privilege,The hypocrite's mask.To the young girl, faith;To the married woman, hope;To the old maid, charity.What am I?
Weight in my belly,Trees on my back,Nails in my ribs,Feet I do lack.What am I?

We are very little creatures; all of us have different features. One of us in glass is set; one of us you'll find in jet. Another you may see in tin, and a fourth is boxed within. If the fifth you should pursue, it can never fly from you.What are we?
If a man carried my burdenHe would break his back.I am not rich,But leave silver in my track.Who am I?
I am seen in the waterIf seen in the sky,I am in the rainbow,A jay's feather,And lapis lazuli.What am I?
choice_list: ['The color blue.', 'The sky', 'A blue jay', 'The ocean']

question: I go around in circles,But always straight aheadNever complain,No matter where I am led.What am I?
When you went into the woods you got me.You hated me yet you wanted to find me.You went home with me cause you couldn't find meWhat was it?
What is it that after you take away the whole, some still remains?
It cannot be seen, it weighs nothing, but when put into a barrel, it makes it lighter. What is it?
I drive men madFor love of me,Easily beaten,Never free.What am I?
When young, I am sweet in the sun.When middle-aged, I make you giddy.When old, I am valued more than ever.What am I?
What is in seasons, seconds, centuries and minutes but not in decades, years or days?
If you have me, you want to share me. If you share me, you haven't got me. What am I?
Poor people have it. Rich people need it. If you eat it for too long you die. What is it?
They have not flesh, nor feathers, nor scales, nor bone. Yet they have fingers and thumbs of their own. What are they?
Only one color, but not one size, Stuck at the bottom, yet easily flies. Present in sun, but not in rain, Doing no harm, and feeling no pain. What is it?
You have me today, Tomorrow you'll have more;As your time passes, I'm not easy to store;I don't take up space, But I'm only in one place;I am what you saw, But not what you see. What am I?
What has a head, a tail, is brown, and has no legs?
I produce moisture and oxygen into the air.When it gets cold, I change colors.When it freezes, I fall down, even if it's not slippery.What am I?

I make ash, but I'm not a bonfire.I can expel rocks, but I'm not a slingshot.I can be a mountain, but I'm not in the Himalayas.I have a crater, but I'm not the Moon.I erupt, but I don't have a bad temper.What am I?
If fruit comes from a fruit tree, where does chicken come from?
Bright pearls were scattered on a black cloth.What are they?
We're very large though we seem small,We float on high and never fall,We shine like jewels in the night,But in the day concealed from sight.What are we?
I saw a restless shepherd travelingBack and forth on his path.He garbs himself in that which goesIn the same and in an opposite direction.He goes hither and thither among creatures.What is it?
Two little golden horns sitting on a cloud, They float slowly in the sky,And look very proud.What is it?
choice_list: ['A unicorn', 'A hot air balloon', 'A young moon.', 'A pair of sunglasses']

question: Hick-a-more, Hack-a-more, On the kitchen floor;All the horses, all the men,Couldn't driveHick-a-more, Hack-a-more,Off the kitchen floor.
What falls on the water but never gets wet?
What has no hands, no feet, no head, and no body, but can open any door?
When rain falls, does it ever get up again?
White sheep on a blue hill.When the winds stop, they stand still.They walk far away when the winds blow.What are they?
I gently patter on the roof at night. I mutter quietly and lull you to sleep, asking, "All sleeping? All right!"What am I?
What man cannot live inside the house?
An old woman sweeps behind the house, but the dust turns up at your doorstep.What is it?
choice_list: ['A gust of wind', 'A broom', 'A vacuum cleaner', 'A blizzard.']

question: Riddle me, riddle me, rin-√ê¬µ-go, mother gave me some seeds to sow. The seeds were black, the ground was white. If you riddle me that, you'll escape my bite.What are they?
choice_list: ['Pen and paper.', 'Keyboard and screen', 'Typewriter and parchment', 'Pencil and notebook']

question: It is energy and motion, it can fly across the ocean.It can listen and even speak, it can see and even seek.It eats neither fruit nor gruel, it eats energy and fuel.Better say: It doesn't eat; It is transformed into heat.What is it?
The shape of my form will waver and bendBy the things I'm destroying and those I will rend.My color changes from bright red to blue,The power I'm using will dictate my hue.What am I?
A house full, a hole full, but you can never gather a bowl full.What is it?
I'm so weak that a little wind can move me.I'm so strong that when you cut me with a knife, it leaves no track.What is it?
What is it that anyone can divide, but no one can see where it is divided?
As I was going o'er London Bridge, I heard something crack. Not a man in all England can mend that!What is it?
My step is slow, and I breathe snow.To the ground, I bring death.My marching brings an end to me,I'm slain by the sun or engulfed by the sea.What am I?
I am all that you see, yet I'm nothing at all, and from you, I will flee.Formed of deception, I will twist your perception.Wherever I'm rising, I warp the horizon.What am I?
If you like being in nature and want to camp overnight, you can sleep in one of these.What is it?
There is a common plantThat's like something in the sky.It is bright yellow,And grows to be 10 feet high.What is it?
I bloom in yellow-golden,With fluffy little chicks.From the cold, I turn barren.What am I?
Colorful flowersBloomed in the garden,Beautiful colorsBut autumn is coming.What flowers are they?
A house with two residents - sometimes one, seldom three.Crack the walls, eat the dwellers, then throw it away.What is it?

question: I have lots of bark but no bite. What am I?
